intro: Thesidium fruticulosum, commonly known as the mossy cushion plant, is a small, low-growing plant belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form composed of tightly packed, short, green stems. The plant produces small, leaf-like structures that are typically arranged in two ranks, with the upper leaves being shorter and more pointed. Thesidium fruticulosum thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in temperate regions on rocky or acidic soils. It plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms and invertebrates.
